solution_line_template: We have {target_distance} km / {initial_distance} km = <<{target_distance}/{initial_distance}={distance_multiplier}>>{distance_multiplier}. So, the distance covered in {target_distance} km is {distance_multiplier} times greater than {initial_distance} km. The time taken will also be {distance_multiplier} times greater.
We convert the time to minutes: {total_time_hours} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{total_time_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={total_time_minutes}>>{total_time_minutes} minutes.
